Question_1.Context: Silicon wet bulk micromachining is a technique used for creating various microstructures. This process can be enhanced by increasing the etching rate, which is the vertical distance etched per unit time.
Question_1.Question: What is the role of etching rate in silicon wet bulk micromachining?
Question_1.A: Determines the color of the microstructures
Question_1.B: Affects the size of the microstructures
Question_1.C: Influences the time required to create microstructures
Question_1.D: Changes the chemical composition of the microstructures
Question_1.Source: Etch rate is a key parameter when etching is involved in silicon micromachining for the formation of microstructures for MEMS-based sensors and actuators. It is defined as the vertical distance etched per unit time (i.e., etch depth (d) per unit time (t) or d/t).

Question_2.Context: In silicon wet bulk micromachining, additives can be introduced to the etching solution to modify the etching characteristics, such as the etch rate.
Question_2.Question: What effect does the addition of hydroxylamine (NH2OH) have on the etching rate in a sodium hydroxide (NaOH) solution?
Question_2.B: Has no effect on the etching rate
Question_2.Source: The addition of NH2OH in NaOH solution remarkably exhibited a two-fold increment in the etching rate of a Si{100} surface.

Question_3.Context: Undercutting at convex corners during wet etching is a phenomenon that can be beneficial for certain MEMS applications, as it relates to the release of microstructures from the substrate.
Question_3.Question: What is the significance of undercutting at convex corners in the context of MEMS fabrication?
Question_3.A: It is undesirable as it increases production costs
Question_3.B: It is crucial for the quick release of microstructures from the substrate
Question_3.C: It is used to increase the thickness of microstructures
Question_3.D: It has no impact on the fabrication process
Question_3.Source: Undercutting at convex corners is highly prudent for the quick release of microstructures from the substrate.

Question_4.Context: The etching characteristics of silicon can be influenced by the age of the etchant solution, which refers to the time elapsed since its preparation.
Question_4.Question: How does the age of an etchant solution with NH2OH added to NaOH affect the etch rate of silicon?
Question_4.A: The etch rate increases with etchant age
Question_4.B: The etch rate decreases with etchant age
Question_4.C: The etch rate remains constant regardless of etchant age
Question_4.D: The etch rate fluctuates unpredictably with etchant age
Question_4.Source: The effect of aging of 12% NH2OH-added 10 M NaOH on the etch rate of Si{100} is investigated. It can obviously be noted that the etch rate significantly decreases up to two days, but there is a minor change after third day.

Question_8.Context: In the process of wet etching, the formation of hydrogen bubbles can affect the etching process by acting as a micro mask on the silicon surface.
Question_8.Question: What is one of the factors that can cause surface roughness during wet etching of silicon?
Question_8.Source: In wet etching, surface roughness is the result of various factors; one is the formation of a hydrogen bubble during etching which hinders the surface reactions and acts like a micro mask on the surface.
